meanings.definition: A type of vacuum tube used in microwave ovens.
meanings.sent1: The magnetron in the microwave oven heats up the food quickly.
meanings.sent2: I need to replace the magnetron in my microwave to make it work again.
meanings.sent3: The magnetron in the microwave seemed to have a mind of its own, randomly turning on.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity was like a magnetron, constantly generating new ideas.
meanings.sent5: The magnetron hummed softly as it cooked the popcorn to perfection.

meanings.definition: A device that generates microwaves for radar systems.
meanings.sent1: The military uses a magnetron to emit microwaves for radar detection.
meanings.sent2: The technician installed a new magnetron in the radar system to improve its performance.
meanings.sent3: The magnetron in the radar system decided to take a break right before an important test.
meanings.sent4: His voice was like a magnetron, sending out powerful waves of sound that captivated the audience.
meanings.sent5: The magnetron's signal was so strong, it could detect objects from miles away.
